name: Famous TV Fools Quiz | Mixture: Classics | 10 Questions

questions.text: "Cheers" originally had "Coach" as the not-too-bright character in residence, then replaced him (after Nicholas Colasanto passed away) with Woody Boyd. Where does Woody Boyd come from?
questions.explanation:
Midwest.

	Hanover, Indiana. (I wonder if the folks in Indiana are amused.) A great show for a long time: everything it did, worked.

questions.text: "MASH" had several characters that were less-than-swift .... although Radar and Klinger both grew considerably as the show went along. Major Burns, however, remained a clod until he (Larry Linville) departed the show. How did Burns depart the series?
options: Pulled strings to get out of the service
Received a hardship discharge for financial reasons
questions.explanation:
Went berserk while away.

	Poor Burns flipped out after he lost Margaret. Good acting job throughout (in kind of a thankless role) by Linville - but the replacement, Major Winchester (David Ogden Stiers), added a wonderful new character to the series.

questions.text: Bob Denver was hapless as Maynard G. Krebs ("Dobie Gillis") and as Gilligan. When the castaways try to make a silent movie about their predicament, what role did Gilligan play?
questions.explanation:
Savage Native.

	He played a savage native that menaced Mary Ann, thus demonstrating the dangers on the island. Denver was fine in both series, but that was about it for him.

questions.text: Ted Knight played the egomaniacal Ted Baxter on "The Mary Tyler Moore Show". Who played his equally vain (and handsome) brother?
questions.explanation:
Jack Cassidy.

	Cassidy played another empty-headed pretty boy. The others played (at different times) romantic interests for Mary.

questions.text: Speaking of Ted Knight, he went on to star in "Too Close For Comfort". What was the name of the goofy character in that show?
questions.explanation:
Monroe.

	Jm J. Bullock (not a typo) played Monroe Ficus.

questions.text: "Three's Company" had Mr. Roper (Norman Fell) play the fool - before the new landlord, Ralph Furley (Don Knotts) took over that role. Who plays the woman that plays up to Ralph because she thinks he has money and property?
questions.explanation:
Ruta Lee.

	Ruta Lee plays the golddigger. Langdon played Cindy's farmer relative in one episode. Wedgeworth played Lana, a regular on the series for a while. Anderson played a romantic interest for Jack in one episode early in the series.

questions.text: "Hogan's Heroes" featured Andrew Carter (Larry Hovis) as the local goofball. What was Carter's expertise in the prison camp?
questions.explanation:
Chemistry and Explosives.

	Carter was a bit slow. LeBeau (Robert Clary) was the cook; Kinch (Ivan Dixon) was the radio operator. Newkirk (Richard Dawson) was the tailor.

questions.text: "The Odd Couple" featured Al Molinaro as Murray, the cop. How does Murray get in good with his boss - at the expense of Felix and Oscar?
questions.correct: Busts Felix' and Oscar's poker game
options: Busts Oscar for using obscene language
Gives Felix a ticket for littering
questions.explanation:
Busts Felix' and Oscar's poker game.

	Molinaro went on to play a somewhat similar role in "Happy Days". (Anson Williams ("Potsy") also played a bit of a dolt there.)

questions.text:
Tim Conway played the ever-bumbling Ensign Parker on "McHale's Navy".
Who played the fast-talking Gruber?
questions.explanation:
Carl Ballantine.

	Stroll played pretty boy "Virgil". Hastings played Elroy Carpenter, the lackey assistant to Captain Binghamton (Joe Flynn). Sand played Tinker.

questions.text: Paul Benedict played the slightly odd Bentley in "The Jeffersons". Where did he work?
questions.explanation:
The U.N.

	He was a translator. Disappeared more-or-less after that.
